analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They reply,

analyzed: kye bdag cag nyid kyang mi shes la /

original: bdag cag nyid kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag nyid kyang mi mthong ngo //

original: sems can de dag gi mchu dag kyang tshig cing lce dang / rkan dang / lkog ma dang / mid pa'i sbubs dang / snying dang / snying gi nye 'khor dang / rgyu ma dang gnye ma rnams kyang tshig nas thur du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi mchu dag kyang tshig cing lce dang / rkan dang / lkog ma dang / mid pa'i sbubs dang / snying dang / snying gi nye 'khor dang / rgyu ma dang gnye ma rnams kyang tshig nas thur du 'byung ngo //
translated: The mouths, tongues, palates, throats, hearts, and abdomens of those beings are burned, and they die.

analyzed: gzhan yang sems can dmyal ba chen po'i srung ma de dag gis sems can de dag mchil pas nya dbyung ba bzhin du phyung nas lcags kyi sa gzhi 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar la kun tu rab tu 'bar te 'bar ba gcig tu gyur pa la gan rkyal
translated: Moreover, the guardians of the great hells pull out those beings with hooks, and then place them on an iron surface that is burning, blazing, and glowing, all of it a single flame.

translated: They reply, “🔽Hey, we don’t know ourselves,

analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: we don’t see ourselves.”

translated: But we are thirsty.” Then the hell guardians open their mouths with an iron awl, and pour in molten copper that is burning, blazing, and glowing.

original: sems can de dag gi mchu dag kyang tshig pa nas thur du 'byung ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi mchu dag kyang tshig pa nas thur du 'byung ba'i bar du ste /

analyzed: de dag de lta bu'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba nas rgyas par bya'o //
translated: They are in that condition…

original: de dag mthu nyams shing gzi byin nyams la brtson 'grus nyams te /
analyzed: de dag mthu nyams shing gzi byin nyams la brtson 'grus nyams te /
translated: They lose their strength, their splendor, and their energy.

original: rnam par rgal gyi 'gram na 'khod do //
analyzed: rnam par rgal gyi 'gram na 'khod do //
translated: They lie down on the banks of the Vaitaraṇī River.

original: rnam par rgal de'i 'gram na khva lcags kyi mchu can zhes bya ba dag gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par rgal de'i 'gram na khva lcags kyi mchu can zhes bya ba dag gnas te /
translated: On the banks of the Vaitaraṇī River live iron-beaked crows.

original: sems can de dag gi zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They peck at those beings…

original: de la sogs pa gnod pa mang po dag byed de /
analyzed: de la sogs pa gnod pa mang po dag byed de /
translated: They do many such things to them.

original: der nam sems can de dag gis sems can dmyal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las de gtan nas yongs su ma byang ma zad kyi bar du ste de dag kyang chu klung rnam par rgal la 'bog go //
analyzed: der nam sems can de dag gis sems can dmyal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las de gtan nas yongs su ma byang ma zad kyi bar du ste de dag kyang chu klung rnam par rgal la 'bog go //
translated: Until the sentient beings there have completely purified and exhausted the non-virtuous karma that is experienced as hell beings, they are thrown into the river.

original: lcags kyi shing shal ma li'i tshal la 'dzeg go //
analyzed: lcags kyi shing shal ma li'i tshal la 'dzeg go //
translated: They climb the iron Shalmali trees.

original: lo ma ral gri lta bu'i tshal du 'jug go //
analyzed: lo ma ral gri lta bu'i tshal du 'jug go //
translated: They enter the forest with sword-like leaves.

original: lam po che spu gri'i so gtams pa lta bur 'gro'o //
analyzed: lam po che spu gri'i so gtams pa lta bur 'gro'o //
translated: They walk on the road of razors.

original: ro myags pa dang / phyi sa'i 'dam du 'bog go //
analyzed: ro myags pa dang / phyi sa'i 'dam du 'bog go //
translated: They are thrown into the swamp of rotting corpses and feces.

original: me ma mur bus mor phyin pa tsam du 'gro'o //
analyzed: me ma mur bus mor phyin pa tsam du 'gro'o //
translated: They walk on the burning coals.

original: de nas sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgor 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgor 'jug go //
translated: Then they enter the eastern gate of the great hell Avīci.

original: ji ste sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo'i skabs su bshad pa de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su 'ang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo'i skabs su bshad pa de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su 'ang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained in the section on the eastern gate of the great hell Avīci, it should be said in the same way for the south, west, and north.

original: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa 'khor dang bcas par bstan pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu cha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / ngu 'bod dang / bsdus gzhom dang / thig nag dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa 'khor dang bcas par bstan pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu cha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / ngu 'bod dang / bsdus gzhom dang / thig nag dang /
translated: Just as the great hell of Avīci is explained, so too should the great hells of Pratāpana, Saṃjīva, Mahāraurava, Raurava, Tapana, Mahā-tapana, Saṃghāta, Kālasūtra,

original: yang sos rnams kyang 'khor dang bcas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang sos rnams kyang 'khor dang bcas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and Saṃghata be explained, along with their surrounding hells.

original: de dag nas sems can de dag gis sems can dmyal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las @90b de gtan nas ma byang ma zad par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de dag nas sems can de dag gis sems can dmyal ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las @90b de gtan nas ma byang ma zad par gyur pa na /
translated: When the non-virtuous karma that sentient beings experience in those hells is completely exhausted,

original: de dag gnas de dag nas shi 'phos nas kha cig ni dud 'gro rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gnas de dag nas shi 'phos nas kha cig ni dud 'gro rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they die and leave those places, and some are born among animals.

original: kha cig ni yi dags rnams kyi nang du /
analyzed: kha cig ni yi dags rnams kyi nang du /
translated: Some are born among hungry ghosts.

original: kha cig ni mi rnams kyi nang du /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi rnams kyi nang du /
translated: Some are born among humans.

original: kha cig ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du /
translated: Some are born among the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: kha cig ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free of Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: de la sems can sngon mir gyur pa'i tshe chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed de /
analyzed: de la sems can sngon mir gyur pa'i tshe chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa byed de /
translated: “Here, some sentient beings, when they were human beings, engaged in unrighteous conduct and did not do what is right.

original: gcig tu gnag pa'i las byed byed pa las sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gcig tu gnag pa'i las byed byed pa las sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Having done only dark actions, they are reborn in the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba nas shi 'phos nas sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa mang po dag gi skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba nas shi 'phos nas sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa mang po dag gi skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having died and passed away from the hells, they are reborn in the human realm, but they are destined to experience much suffering, unhappiness, and turmoil.

original: de la sems can sngon mir gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la sems can sngon mir gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: “Here, some sentient beings, when they were human beings,

original: chos spyod cing rigs pa byed pa gcig tu dkar pa'i las byed byed pa las nye bar spyod pa 'ga' zhig sems can dmyal pa dag tu skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba nas shi 'phos nas bde ba dang yid bde ba mang
analyzed: chos spyod cing rigs pa byed pa gcig tu dkar pa'i las byed byed pa las nye bar spyod pa 'ga' zhig sems can dmyal pa dag tu skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba nas shi 'phos nas bde ba dang yid bde ba mang
translated: Those who engage in virtuous actions, such as practicing Dharma and acting in accordance with logic, may still be born in the hells due to some specific circumstances.🔽Those who die and transmigrate from the hells will experience🔽happiness and mental satisfaction.

original: ba'i skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who engage in Dharma activity and virtuous actions are reborn in the hells, but after dying in the hells, they are reborn in the higher rebirths and experience the results of their virtuous actions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lha'i pho nya lnga lung bstan pa'i mdo las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lha'i pho nya lnga lung bstan pa'i mdo las 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavān also says in the Sūtra of the Five Divine Messengers:

original: dge slong dag sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo 'byed pa de'i dus kyang yod la /
analyzed: dge slong dag sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs kyi sgo 'byed pa de'i dus kyang yod la /
translated: “Monks, there is a time and occasion when the eastern gate of the great Avīci Hell opens.

original: skabs kyang yod de zhes bya ba nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs kyang yod de zhes bya ba nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa'i lha rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: . . . They are reborn in the Heaven of Controlling Others’ Emanations and experience the results of their virtuous actions.”

original: dge slong dag de la sems can gang dag mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la sems can gang dag mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la ri mo mi byed pa dang /
translated: who do not hold their fathers as authorities, who do not hold ascetics as authorities, who do not hold brahmins as authorities, who do not honor the elders in their families,🔽who do not do what should be done, who do not make merit,

original: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed la /
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed la /
translated: who do not fear the misdeeds that are in the next world, who do not give gifts, who do not make merit,

original: za gcig pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: za gcig pa la mi gnas te /
translated: who do not practice the one-meal-a-day rule,

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs @91a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs @91a * //
translated: who do not take up moral discipline,

original: nas mi 'dug ba de dag ni /
analyzed: nas mi 'dug ba de dag ni /
translated: who do not sit down,

original: tshul 'di lta bur sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul 'di lta bur sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: are destined for suffering and unhappiness in this way.

original: dper na sems can dmyal ba na 'dug pa'i sems can rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems can dmyal ba na 'dug pa'i sems can rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the sentient beings who are in the hells.

original: de la sems can gang dag mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa nas snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa nas snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Those sentient beings who have a mother, a father, and so on, as before,

original: de dag ni tshul 'di lta bur bde ba dang yid bde ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni tshul 'di lta bur bde ba dang yid bde ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: will have the fortune of happiness and mental pleasure in this way.

original: dper na gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i lha rnams bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i lha rnams bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: For example, it is like the gods who dwell in the celestial palaces.

original: de la gnod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar dag go //
analyzed: de la gnod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar dag go //
translated: There, “harm” refers to the ten unwholesome courses of action, from killing up to wrong view.

original: byas nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byas nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug ces bya ba yin no //
translated: “Having done” means having taken them up and lived by them.

original: mi rigs pa'i 'tsho ba'i mi rnams kyis zhes bya ba la mi rigs pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni shan pa dang / bya gag 'tshong ba dang / phag 'tshong ba dang / bya ba dang / ri bong rgyas shor ba dang / nya pa dang /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i 'tsho ba'i mi rnams kyis zhes bya ba la mi rigs pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni shan pa dang / bya gag 'tshong ba dang / phag 'tshong ba dang / bya ba dang / ri bong rgyas shor ba dang / nya pa dang /
translated: “By the people who have an improper livelihood” means by the butchers, poultry keepers, pig farmers, hunters, trappers, and fishermen,

original: ri dags kyi rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / ba lang gsod pa dang / sbrul tshogs can dang / btson srung dang / phra ma can dang / gnod byed dang / de la sogs pa gzhan yang gang zag gang yin pa de dag ces bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o//
analyzed: ri dags kyi rngon pa dang / chom rkun dang / gshed ma dang / ba lang gsod pa dang / sbrul tshogs can dang / btson srung dang / phra ma can dang / gnod byed dang / de la sogs pa gzhan yang gang zag gang yin pa de dag ces bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o//
translated: hunters, thieves, butchers, snake charmers, jailers, slanderers, and those who do harm, and so on.

original: 'gro ba phyi ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa byed pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba phyi ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa byed pa la /
translated: “The next world” refers to those who do what is improper.

original: mi rigs pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de dag yang dag par blangs pa de lta bu dang / yang dag par spyad pa de lta bu'i las de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa de dag yang dag par blangs pa de lta bu dang / yang dag par spyad pa de lta bu'i las de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Those who live by what is improper” refers to those who have taken up and practice such actions that lead to rebirth in the eight great hells.

original: dmyal ba brgyad po 'di dag ni yang sos nas bzung ste mnar med pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: dmyal ba brgyad po 'di dag ni yang sos nas bzung ste mnar med pa'i bar ram /
translated: These eight hells are from the Reviving Hell up to the Great Screaming Hell,

original: yang na mnar med pa nas bzung ste yang sos kyi bar dag go //
analyzed: yang na mnar med pa nas bzung ste yang sos kyi bar dag go //
translated: or from the Great Screaming Hell up to the Reviving Hell.

original: de bas na dmyal ba brgyad po 'di dag ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dmyal ba brgyad po 'di dag ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “the eight hells.”

original: bstan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pas de bas na bstan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pas de bas na bstan zhes bya'o //
translated: “Teaching” means that the buddhas, the śrāvakas of the buddhas, the holy ones, those who have entered the right path, and the holy beings have taught it.

original: thar bar dka' zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po 'di dag thar bar dka' zhing 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: thar bar dka' zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po 'di dag thar bar dka' zhing 'da' bar dka' ba ste /
translated: “Difficult to escape” means that these eight great hells are difficult to escape and difficult to get out of.

original: de bas na thar bar dka' @91b ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thar bar dka' @91b ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “difficult to escape.”

original: brlang ba'i las byas rnams kyis gang zhes bya ba ni shan pa nas gnod byed kyi bar de dag ni brlang ba'i las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brlang ba'i las byas rnams kyis gang zhes bya ba ni shan pa nas gnod byed kyi bar de dag ni brlang ba'i las zhes bya ste /
translated: “Where those who have done violent actions go” means that from butchers up to those who do harm are called “those who have done violent actions.”

original: de bas na dmyal ba brgyad po 'di ni thar par dka' bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na dmyal ba brgyad po 'di ni thar par dka' bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, these eight hells are taught as difficult to escape.

original: brlang ba'i las byas rnams kyis gang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brlang ba'i las byas rnams kyis gang zhes bya'o //
translated: “Where those who have done violent actions go” is said.

original: re re'i 'khor ni bcu drug yod ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs na lhag pa'i 'khor bzhi yod de /
analyzed: re re'i 'khor ni bcu drug yod ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa'i shar phyogs na lhag pa'i 'khor bzhi yod de /
translated: In the east of the great Avīci Hell there are four additional surrounding hells:

original: ro myags pa dang / phyi sa'i 'dam dang / lo ma ral gri lta bu'i tshal dang / lcags kyi shal ma li'i tshal dang / chu klung rnam par rgal zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: ro myags pa dang / phyi sa'i 'dam dang / lo ma ral gri lta bu'i tshal dang / lcags kyi shal ma li'i tshal dang / chu klung rnam par rgal zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: the Swamp of Putrid Corpses, the Swamp of Excrement, the Forest of Sword-like Leaves, and the Forest of Iron Spikes.

original: shar phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the east, there are also these in the south, west, and north.
